Version notice:

Lab 1 - Rules Config¶

This lab consists of the following tasks:

  1. Creating the default service policy.
  2. Creating the service policy for email parameter verification.
  3. Testing the service policy.
  4. Applying the service policies to the HTTP Load Balancer.

Table of Contents

  • Default Service Policy
  • Service Policy for Email Parameter Verification
  • Testing The Service Policy
  • Applying Service Policies to The HTTP Load Balancer

Default Service Policy¶

  1. Create the default service policy which will allow all:

    1. Go to Web App & API Protection -> Service Policies -> Service Policies -> Add Service Policy and fill in the below data:

      Field Value
      Name default-allow
      Select Policy Rules Allow All Requests

Service Policy for Email Parameter Verification¶

  1. Create the service policy which will verify that the email parameter value is in the appropriate email format:

    1. Go to Web App & API Protection -> Service Policies -> Service Policies -> Add Service Policy and fill in the below data:

      Field Value
      Name arcadia-parameter-inspection

    2. On the same page click Configure -> Add Item and fill in the below data:

      Field Value
      Name email
      HTTP Method POST

    3. Click Configure under the HTTP Path section, Add Item under the Exact Values section and fill in the below data. Click Apply.

      Field Value
      Input box that just appeared /v1/login

    4. Click the Show Advanced Fields switch under the Request Match section and Add Item under Argument Matchers.

      Field Value
      Argument Name email

    5. Click Add Item under the Regex Values section, fill in the below data and click Apply three times, then click Save and Exit.

      Field Value
      Input box that just appeared [A-Za-z0-9._%+-]+@[A-Za-z0-9.-]+.[A-Za-z]{2,}
      Invert Matcher Checked

Testing The Service Policy¶

  1. Before we apply the service policy, let’s do some tests:

    1. Do a curl request to simulate a user login request. The request should succeed.

      curl -H "Content-Type: application/json;charset=UTF-8" --data-raw "{\"email\":\"satoshi@bitcoin.com\",\"password\":\"bitcoin\"}" http://arcadia-re-$$makeId$$.workshop.emea.f5se.com/v1/login

    2. Re-run the same request but with the email parameter value being just a number. The login will fail but the request will not be blocked.

      curl -H "Content-Type: application/json;charset=UTF-8" --data-raw "{\"email\":\"11223344\",\"password\":\"bitcoin\"}" http://arcadia-re-$$makeId$$.workshop.emea.f5se.com/v1/login

Applying Service Policies to The HTTP Load Balancer¶

  1. Apply the service policies to the HTTP Load Balancer:

    1. Go to Web App & API Protection -> Load Balancers -> HTTP Load Balancer. Click the 3 dots under the arcadia-re-lb row and select Manage Configuration -> Edit Configuration. Fill in the below data and click Save and Exit.

      Field Value
      Service Policies Apply Specified Service Policies

    2. On the same page click Configure under Policies, Add Item and fill in the below data. Click Apply and then click Save and Exit.

      Field Value
      First Input Box $$namespace$$/arcadia-parameter-inspection
      Second Input Box $$namespace$$/default-allow
